etymology.description: Originally depicted as a pipe 筒(筒) (tǒng, "pipe") -> 口 added as decoration -> interpreted as mouth 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") giving orders -> evolved to mean togetherness and unity
etymology.interpretation: The character 同(同) (tóng, "same; unity; together; common") originally depicted a pipe but later took on the symbolic meaning of unity, possibly influenced by the shared cooperation in activities like music or rigid group tasks. The addition of 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") emphasizes communication and collaboration.

examples.chinese: 我们同心协力(我們同心協力)。
examples.english: We work together with one heart and mind.

examples.chinese: 他们穿着同款衣服(他們穿著同款衣服)，看起来十分整齐(看起來十分整齊)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen chuānzhe tóng kuǎn yīfú, kàn qǐlái shífēn zhěngqí.
examples.english: They are wearing the same style of clothes and look very orderly.
